intro: Cremanthodium pteridophyllum, commonly known as the featherleaf pincushion, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or alpine habitats. Its small, yellowish flowers bloom in the summer, and it produces achenes as its seeds. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
